chronic adenotonsillitis and ankyloglossia.
chronic adenotonsillitis and ankyloglossia.
this is a 3-year-old child with a history of adenotonsillitis.
this is a 3-year-old child with a history of adenotonsillitis.
procedure performed: 1. adenoidectomy and tonsillectomy. 2. lingual frenulectomy.
procedure performed: 1. adenoidectomy and tonsillectomy. 2. lingual frenulectomy.
procedure performed: 1. adenoidectomy and tonsillectomy. 2. lingual frenulectomy.
anesthesia: general endotracheal.
findings/specimen: tonsil and adenoid tissue.
complications: none.
the patient is stable and tolerated the procedure well, and sent to pacu.
the tonsil was then amputated at the same plane as tongue base.
the tonsil fascia planes were identified with bovie dissection along the plane. the tonsil was freed from anterior pillar and posterior pillar.
the tonsil fascia planes were identified with bovie dissection along the plane. the tonsil was freed from anterior pillar and posterior pillar.
an adenoid mirror was used to view the patient's adenoids.
an adenoid curet was used to remove the patient's adenoid tissue.
the tonsil fascia planes were identified with bovie dissection along the plane.
needle tip cautery was used to free the superior pole of tonsil.
suction cautery was used to allow for hemostasis.
mcivor mouth gag was inserted.
a curved hemostat was used to grasp the lingual frenulum.
the tonsil was then grasped in medial superior aspect with a straight hemostat.
metzenbaum scissors were used to free the lingual frenulum.
the tonsil fascia planes were identified with bovie dissection along the plane.
the tonsil was freed from anterior pillar and posterior pillar.
the tonsil was then amputated at the same plane as tongue base.
the patient is stable and tolerated the procedure well, and sent to pacu.
